alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Cherokee; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 12:09AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Calhoun, eastern Etowah and southwestern Cherokee Counties through 100 AM CST... At 1209 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Neely Henry Lake, or 7 miles southeast of Rainbow City, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Piedmont, Hokes Bluff, Glencoe, Ohatchee, Leesburg, Ballplay, Slackland, Gadsden Mall, Ball Flat, Neely Henry Lake, Western Weiss Lake, Southside, Gadsden Steam Plant, Big Wills Creek, Cobb City, Knightens Crossroads, Sulphur Springs and Gadsden Water Works. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for central and northeastern Alabama.
